choices.text: Significantly lowers blood pressure in most patients.

questions.text: A 55-year-old man reports difficulty starting and maintaining urination. Ultrasound shows an enlarged prostate. He is started on tamsulosin. Which of the following statements is correct regarding this medication?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

The given clinical scenario suggests benign prostatic hyperplasia. The true statement regarding tamsulosin is retrograde ejaculation is a significant side effect.

questions.text: A 52-year-old male patient presented with severe restlessness, palpitations, facial flushing, and sweating. The patient had an episode of dysentery 2 days prior and had been prescribed medication for that. The patient reports taking alcohol 2 hours after his medications. Which of the following drug does not cause similar effects?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Ofloxacin

The given clinical scenario of a patient developing symptoms like restlessness and flushing after taking alcohol after medication is suggestive of a disulfiram-like reaction. Among the given drugs, ofloxacin is not associated with a disulfiram-like reaction.

questions.text: A female suffered a head injury from a road traffic accident. On examination, there is elevated intracranial pressure. Which diuretic among the following can be used in her condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Mannitol

In this patient with raised intracranial pressure after a road traffic accident, mannitol is the diuretic of choice in her management to reduce intracranial pressure

questions.text: A 27-year-old male patient on anticoagulant therapy for his DVT started coughing up blood. He has a history of irregular warfarin intake. Workup revealed elevated INR and diffuse alveolar hemorrhage. Which of the following agents would be the best choice for immediate reversal of bleeding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Prothrombin complex concentrates

Immediate or urgent reversal of warfarin-induced bleeding is best achieved by the administration of prothrombin complex concentrates (PCC). These are highly purified concentrates prepared from pooled plasma and contain factors II, IX, and X. Factor VII may be included or produced separately.

questions.text: A child presented with recurrent episodes of cough with expectoration. Investigations revealed a positive sweat chloride test. Inhalational formulation of which of the following aminoglycosides is approved for use in this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Tobramycin

The given clinical scenario is suggestive of cystic fibrosis. Inhalational formulation of tobramycin is approved for use in cystic fibrosis patients with Pseudomonas aeruginosa infections.

questions.text: During a study on the cytotoxic effects of alkylating agents, you observe that cyclophosphamide has a higher cytotoxic effect compared to procarbazine. Which property of cyclophosphamide is the reason for this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Cross-linking of DNA

Cyclophosphamide (nitrogen mustard) is a bifunctional alkylating agent and it results in cross-linking of DNA that causes a major disruption in nucleic acid function and increased cytotoxicity.

questions.text: A patient with erectile dysfunction complained of unsatisfactory response to oral medication. He was then administered an intracavernosal injection of phentolamine following which he developed sustained painful erection. Which of the following can be used to reverse his condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Phenylephrine

The reversal of phentolamine induced priapism (painful erection) can be achieved by intracavernosal injection of phenylephrine. Intracavernosal phentolamine (a-blocker) is used for the management of impotency. Priapism is a serious adverse effect of this agent. Phenylephrine is an a agonist and counteracts phentolamine induced priapism by producing vasoconstriction.

questions.text: A 25-year-old patient presented to the ER with an acute attack of migraine. You decide to administer a long-acting triptan. Which among the following do you choose?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Frovatriptan

Frovatriptan is a long-acting triptan among other triptans. Headache recurrences in an attack are less with longer- acting triptans like frovatriptan and naratriptan but onset of action may be slow.

questions.text: A chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) patient requires a step-up in therapy due to symptom persistence. Which PDE-4 inhibitor can you prescribe as an add-on drug to his treatment regimen?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Roflumilast

Roflumilast is a PDE-4 selective inhibitor approved for use in COPD. PDE-4 is the major isoform present in inflammatory cells and its inhibition results in higher anti-inflammatory effects

questions.text: A child with impaired cognitive function was admitted for evaluation in the pediatrics ward. On examination, you find multiple types of seizures, an EEG showing slow ( < 3Hz) spike and wave discharges, and diagnosed with Lennox-Gastaut syndrome. Which among the following options is a first-line drug for his condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Sodium valproate Sodium valproate is a first-line drug for the treatment of Lennox-Gastaut syndrome.

questions.text: A diabetic patient being treated with an oral hypoglycemic agent develops dilutional hyponatremia. Which one of the following could be responsible for the effect?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Chlorpropamide

Chlorpropamide use is associated with dilutional hyponatremia. It is a first generation sulfonylurea and can lead to SIADH.

questions.text: A child with absence seizures improves after being treated with ethosuximide. Which of the following is the mechanism of action of this drug?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Inhibits T type Ca2+ channels

The mechanism of action of ethosuximide is by inhibition of T-type Ca2+ channels in thalamic neurons at clinically relevant concentrations. It also affects other ion channels affected include voltage- gated sodium channels and potassium channels.

questions.text: A pregnant woman at 33 weeks of gestation presents to your antenatal clinic with preterm labour. Which corticosteroid will you administer for stimulation of fetal lung maturation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Betamethasone

Betamethasone is indicated for the stimulation of fetal lung maturation in preterm labor.

questions.text: A patient who is on treatment for hyperlipidemia develops gallstones. What is the mechanism of action of the causative drug that was given to this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Activates PPAR alpha

The antilipidemic drugs likely to cause gallstones are the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptors (PPARs) that act by activating PPAR alpha.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man has presented to the OPD with a complaint of erectile dysfunction not responding to oral medication. The issue is determined to be of vascular origin. Which prostaglandin preparation can be given as a local injection to treat this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Alprostadil

Alprostadil (PGE1) is given as an intracavernosal injection or urethral suppository for erectile dysfunction. It is considered as a second-line therapy. Its use has been largely replaced by phosphodiesterase-5 inhibitors like sildenafil and tadalafil which are the drugs of choice.

questions.text: A patient with mania has been initiated on lithium therapy. While counseling the patient about the medication, which of the following effects do you mention as the most common CNS adverse effect?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Fine tremors

The most common CNS adverse effect of lithium in the therapeutic dose range is fine postural hand tremors. Therapeutic lithium tremor is generally symmetric, limited to the arms, and nonprogressive.

questions.text: A patient started on antihypertensive presented with the following picture. Which of the following drugs is the most likely cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

Lisinopril

The image shows edema over the lips and face and its occurrence following intake of an antihypertensive is suggestive of drug-induced angioedema. Lisinopril being an ACE inhibitor is most likely to be responsible for this condition.

questions.text: During a preoperative anesthetic evaluation, pharmacologic stress echocardiography is being undertaken for a patient with chronic pulmonary disease. Which of the following agents can be used for inducing pharmacological stress in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Dobutamine

Dobutamine can be used for the induction of pharmacological stress in a patient with chronic pulmonary disease.

questions.text: The blood pressure of a patient undergoing a coronary artery bypass surgery suddenly rises to 170/110mm Hg. Which of the following can you administer intravenously for immediate management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Clevidipine

Clevidipine is a dihydropyridine available for intravenous administration and is indicated in the acute management of hypertension. It has a short half-life (1-2 minutes) and a rapid onset of action

questions.text: A 55-year-old male complains of severe, sharp, piercing intermittent electrical shock-like pain sensation on the left side of his face. The pain was triggered by talking, washing his face, eating, and brushing his teeth. Which of the following drugs is most effective to treat this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Carbamazepine

The clinical features in this patient are suggestive of a diagnosis of trigeminal neuralgia and carbamazepine is the most effective agent for its treatment. If carbamazepine is ineffective, then second-line agents like lamotrigine and phenytoin are used.
